website_summaries.verdict: Affordable entry-level mesh WiFi system that offers up to 510 square metres of coverage. Setup is easy thanks to step-by-step guide in the app.
pros: Prioritising coverage over speed, this basic mesh WiFi system is a reliable, low-cost option
Three spiral units have a unique look
Signal covers homes up to 510 square meters
cons: System struggles if multiple devices connect to same unit

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The throughput is not as good as other brands, but the additional features (Anti-Virus and QOS) makes this product well worth the price. While I did not have any issues with the app as other reviewers have had, I do wish it was accessible by a browser on the network. But that should not stop you from purchasing this product. I have ZERO dead areas in my home. I just wished that TP-Link made an ourdoor version so that guest can access the Wireless from the backyard during get togethers.
customer_reviews.author: lawrench

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!!! We finally have WiFi with no dead spots!!!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a large Georgian house with 18inch thick walls, we have fibre optic but using net gear extenders still left us with a lot of dead spots with no internet. The WiFi was so bad we couldn’t use wireless printers, our Sonos system wasn’t working. We got this as we were desperate - everything now works seamlessly. The delivered internet speed is super fast and accessible throughout the whole house.
customer_reviews.author: chloe

customer_reviews.title: You will very quickly forget.......................
customer_reviews.text: about poor WiFi, dropped connections, using several different WiFi networks with their attendant issues, just open the laptop anywhere and start surfing full fast signal ALL the time. Reception at the furthest reach of our 300 year old property (walls two feet thick) is within 2 Mbps of the base unit, TV streams seamlessly, a printer that works from anywhere in the property. My biggest regret is wasting time and money on "easy" options, plug in range extenders which sort of work. Just buy the best and buy it once, it really is superb. Review from a 70 year old only recently graduated from quill pens, if I can get this kit working anyone can.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple but True
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best and easiest " to set up " mesh system of them all ! Download the app on your phone, connect power to one of the "Deco's" and connect it to your router ....wait until it flashes blue....use the app , wait until it turns solid blue .....that's it , repeat with the other two and place them strategically around your house leaving one connected to your router. I used one as an AP.....simply run an RJ45 cable from the Deco connected to your router to another Deco anywhere you want.....simple.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus O'neill

customer_reviews.title: Superb kit! Must have for old homes.
customer_reviews.text: I wasted loads of money and time on expensive routers, extenders and powerlines. None of them worked to resolve my Wi-Fi issues. Then I purchased this item and boy it's great! No more black spots around the house and even gives me Wi-Fi in my garden! Less intrusive than my previous router with no downsides. Why I did't buy this earlier i'll never know!
customer_reviews.author: Harj

customer_reviews.title: The best value for money so if you are looking for this type of system DO IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am no technical person so I am over the moon to say that this bit of kit is so easy to set up and install. The App based instructions work! and I was up and running with this in no time at all (20 mins). The performance so far is outstanding in the days before this product I could spend hours trying to get my old WiFi extender to work. So If you want an EASY to install mesh system then go for it I really think this will be the best investment in computer stuff I have and will ever make.
customer_reviews.author: karen brown

customer_reviews.title: Parental Controls Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely brilliant. No more dead zones in the house and no more going to make tea while a new page loads up. We now have superfast connection all over the house. But what I find the absolute best is the parental controls. I can now remotely unplug my child from Fortnite. You can set times for use from Mon - Frid and different times at weekends. But you can also stop the internet immediately on whatever device they're playing on. Just set up a profile with your child's name and add the devices that they use to this profile. Brilliant. No more "I'll be there in a minute." Happy days
customer_reviews.author: Nicola

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage but power-hungry and expensive to run
customer_reviews.text: Good coverage but at 13p/KWHr (typical UK rates) each disk costs £16.40 per annum to run so the set of three I purchased costs around £49 per annum to run. Not great!
customer_reviews.author: Travelbug M

customer_reviews.title: X20s a massive step back in performance.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased due to lack of quality and speed from M4 decos but within an hour realised these were a waste of time. Assumed as the X20 were the brand new versions would outperform other decos but the M9 plus wipes the floor with these. When a metre away got full speed but move 3 metres away or even through one plasterboard wall and speed drops 70-80% and even struggled to add second x20 as range was too far which was around 6 metres away which is ridiculous. Sent back for a refund. Come on Tp-link you need to do much better with new product releases.
customer_reviews.author: nictry

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and forget solution to improve WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my inlaws to improve their Sky WiFi. They had a couple of NETGEAR extenders, but having the _EXT second network made moving things like echo devices between rings a problem. Setup in minutes and vastly improves their coverage throughout their bungalow with just one network 👏 As I have another Deco I can manage theirs on my phone at the same time as my own 👍
customer_reviews.author: mdr1970

customer_reviews.title: Ok product but speed not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Product is ok hut returning to get one with powerline as backhaul. I use this for remote working and noticed that work freezes. I have never noticed this when using a bt powerline adapter which is brilliant. This is my configuration. Dowstairs hub to sky modem. Upstairs hub connected via ethernet backhaul. Unsure if 5.8 ghz used or ethernet backhaul. App is simple but doesnt give status on backhaul, dropped packets or diagnostics. Wifi in house has improved but I think for the price, I need something which can be reliable in terms of signal.
customer_reviews.author: A. Matt

customer_reviews.title: So far, so brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Have struggled with internet for years. Thick walls, two floor apartment, sluggish wifi, inexistent in some rooms. I have fibre and never got above 30 mbps on any device. Ten minutes setup, ugly router now hidden away as it had to be placed in full view before, and speeds averaging 75 mbps to 35 in the far away areas. We shall see how long it lasts. If it remains like this, then this has to be the best 200 quid i have spent in a long while
customer_reviews.author: Mr Ed

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic solution to my WiFi issues
customer_reviews.text: After many years of messing with various power line extenders and WiFi repeaters in our 2500 square foot house with concrete ceilings I finally got it sussed using this kit. No more sudden WiFi drop outs and no more complaining family members. Three of these units have now restored WiFi AND peace throughout our house. The WiFi signal provided is better than being connected directly to the Router. Installation is super easy and I was up and running in less than 20 mins. I moved the upstairs unit around a little to find the best spot and that was all really. Highly recommend this product after using it for about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvester Hiemstra

customer_reviews.title: Too dumbed down
customer_reviews.text: For those looking to set up a mesh wifi system, I tested three and this TP-Link was the first. I bought it because it was the lowest cost from a name brand, I paid £15o on Amazon but it seems to be £200 now. It worked OK, but was way too dumbed down to be of practical use. There is no PC interface at all, not even a browser page. Basic things like static IP settings are hidden, and other routine network settings just don’t exist. For very basic use it may be OK, but if you want any kind of control look elsewhere. I also thought the units themselves looked cheap and silly.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rush

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Mesh WiFi System
customer_reviews.text: 2nd set of these I've purchased as my son has his own network set up. They give great coverage through solid brick walls. I get full signal at the end of my 100ft garden with the last unit placed in the front room at the back of the house. I have also got some linked to my M5 Mesh system too and they work seamlessly. Deco app is easy to use and can configure however you want to. If you are a Virgin Media customer it's best to put your Virgin Superhub in modem only mode for better signal strength.
customer_reviews.author: Tezza Tucker Golding

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as designed
customer_reviews.text: I installed 3 of these in our terraced house as we have a new loft conversion. We put one one each floor and it works perfectly and Wi-Fi is really strong all over the house. I particularly link the app which is really intuitive and set up super easy. I was able to set up parental controls and monitor my children's access. overall an excellent product I would highly recommend. it looks nice in the house too as as a sleek simple design. Only flaw would be a cradle included so it could be hung on the wall but I have seen something on Amazon which would work if I decide to buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Sandyfoot

customer_reviews.title: Returning to vendor
customer_reviews.text: Really hopeless product. If it gets stuck at the stage when it looks for Bluetooth connection, the help requires an internet connection, which you have disconnected in order to connect this up. And if you live in an area with poor data you are stuck. The help chat is absolutely useless. The worst I’ve used. Given up and returning this unusable item. Surprising given brand strength.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Like the computers of today the more that you add the more power you need. I have a strange shaped house and the signal gets lost in corners. Not the easiest to set up as I am a relative novice but got there in the end with the help of good old plusnet tech support. Thank you chaps all turned out well in the end. The signal is now very even across the house and there is less interference from the many added contraptions such as Echos and smart plugs and teles all over the shop. I hope it stays like this as it is much improved at the minute from my previous piecemeal system.
customer_reviews.author: miketromv

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought all sorts of wifi boosters that only marginally worked in the past. Finally found something that really works and our signal no longer drops out every 5 minutes! We now have a fantastic service throughout the house, and garden eliminating the many dead zones we've suffered for years. My son set this up in minutes after downloading the app to his phone which allows you to tweak the settings and check signal strength etc. This is a pricey kit but absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: D Cutts

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useless
customer_reviews.text: Didn't do anything as advertised. It was a nightmare to set up. The powerline functionality didn't work. The air wifi signal was weaker than I got from two year old TP powerline products and didn't go through walls at all. The mesh isn't even compatible with high end TP routers. This doesn't mesh your home wifi, it replaces it. Up until now I was a TP loyalist, but this product is an absolute piece of garbage. It might impress someone who's never tried alternatives, but nobody else.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. M. D. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Works - these are great
customer_reviews.text: These work. I have used other range extenders in the past which have made a marginal difference, but these really do what you need them to. I found them really easy to install and they have extended my signal from being available in one room to the whole house. My house is built of granite with a side extension, previously no signal at all in the extension due to the granite partition wall. Now we have a full signal throughout. I have the three unit pack. Base in the lounge, one in the kitchen, one in the study which serves two further bedrooms with playstations.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hirst

customer_reviews.title: Cured!
customer_reviews.text: Cured! We have a three storey house approximately 1500 square feet and used network plugs. Useless! The M9 has eliminated all our problems of speed and no more dead spots. Ordered two pairs when they were on offer at 3179.00 per pair. Overkill maybe, but we are planning to move next year to a larger house so we are future proof. Easy to set up, all working together within 10 minutes. No issues and the app is simple to use and includes parental controls and virus protection. With a three year warranty, there’s peace of mind too.
customer_reviews.author: Skid Kid

customer_reviews.title: Swapped out deco m5 for these. Huge win
customer_reviews.text: We have a million (ish) devices connected on our home network including multiple computers,TVs, lighting, heating, cams and loads more. The m5 (3 pods) solved the issue of dead spots nicely as our home is wide, however we were getting drop outs all the time. Swapped the m5 for new m9 connected to the router then reset all the 5s to use as auxiliaries. Total of 5 pods in play now. Huge improvement, no drop outs on anything since. Seems the 5s have trouble with too many dhcp connections, or maybe just gets a bit confused. I’ll post back if this changes but definitely a huge improvement on previous set up and obviously even greater coverage
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two units some month ago. At first the unit up stairs didn't work that great, in a tucked away small bedroom area. So I moved the unit to an open landing area, what a massive difference it made! Obviously the second unit needed a good signal from the first unit, that was stationed next to my router downstairs. Now everyone upstairs in any room gets almost full bandwidth, i.e 190-200MB, from a top router speed of 220MB.
customer_reviews.author: Happyman

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonders for my Virgin home internet
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up once my Virgin router was switched to modem mode. Security feature also blocked and flagged an attack on one of my WD NAS drives that I was unaware of. Much speeds and signal strength through my home and not a single drop-out of internet connectivity, something that was quite regular with the Virgin router.
customer_reviews.author: DavidUKNE

customer_reviews.title: Is anything but stable
customer_reviews.text: When they work the wifi connectivity is good and seamless when moving around the house. However, they drop the internet connection almost daily and require a 10 minr eboot to bring it back. Sometimes the main router also forgets it's settings (e.g. name) and the secondary routers disconnect from it and will not reconnect back - they require a hard reset and set up from scratch to get them to work. All in all, a waste of money as the wifi is worse with these than it was with the free BT router.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good speed and coverage but coverage less than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works well but the range is not as good as they state. It plugs into our existing router and Our whole house now has Fairly quick WiFi whereas before it didn’t. We had used a netgear WiFi extender before but it was slow. Outside cameras also have much better and quicker signal now. However our garden which is not far from the second router hardly gets any WiFi. Per the stated area of coverage we should have our whole garden having WiFi. The set up process was fairly easy but we still have our old WiFi as a choice, not sure how to turn that off. Overall happy and would recommend but the stated distances of coverage are not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.

customer_reviews.title: Improved Our Signal, But Fiddly Set Up
customer_reviews.text: Used these with my Plusnet router, so had to set up in access point mode. Read what to do on the internet, but still had major problems setting up. Rang technical support who tried to be helpful, but they did not solve my setup issues. Started afresh the following day and managed to sort it all out myself with the help of the internet. Now they are working, they help signal strength throughout the house, but perhaps the best effect is to stabilise our pretty inconsistent Plusnet broadband which used to suffer lots of dropouts. Well worth the £90 paid and looking forward to changing my provider when my contract is up.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Bratley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Just installed my Deco 5 System, very easy in a large 4 bed detached house. Originally had poor/no connection in conservatory, none in garden and poor reception dropping to 2G i rear bedrooms used has office. We have Virgin 200Mb and now have 200+ in lounge (where Virgin V2 box is and over 100Mb everywhere else indoors, I even have 40Mb in the garden where there was none before. The only downside, deciding to have a new wifi network name so having to reconnect umpteen, iPads, iPhones, laptops, cctv system, printers etc. . but well worth if for the coverage we now have. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. A. Lye

customer_reviews.title: No better than the much cheaper powerline adaptors
customer_reviews.text: Previously used powerline extenders, but had problems with connectivity dropping. Just spent more than £330 on a 3-pack of m9 plus and it's no better. Not even connected 24 hours and already having problems. Devices keep dropping and now I've got a problem with the "main" device. My house is quite large (5 bedroom detached over three floors) and is only 20 years old, so not exactly old-style thick walls either. Wish I hadn't bothered.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!! What a difference
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4G router as our broadband would only give us 2-3mb so had to go down the 4G route. Been using an upgraded 4g round for the last 12 months B525 Huawei which has been good. Was able to get between 10-15mbps around the house but had some dead spots. Just installed the deco system and turned off the wifi feature on the Huawei and now just using the deco signal. This is early days but now getting between 50-60mbps around the house and no dead spots. Very impressed, let's hope it stays like this.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Virgin media router which I'm now running in modem only mode. It was easy to install although I found out the hard way that it's not a good idea to put your router in modem mode before you've downloaded everything you needc from the Internet (including instructiuons on how to switch the router back into router mode)! It is far better at providing the whole house and half the garden with a wifi signal and there being three small items I no longer have to put items needing an ethernet connection (like my NAS) next to my Virgin router. The onlky down side is needing extra power points, one for each item.
customer_reviews.author: Ned

customer_reviews.title: Stable signal with awesome coverage - should easily cover your whole home
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably easy to set up. Good fast stable signal. Decent looks cables are decent length App has most features and provides most of control needed. Ability to set up priority equipment / and or limit speeds to equipment. Ability to set up available wifi times. Ability to set up additional guest network Ability to control wifi access to devices/kids etc. Wifi/or Cable via electric wiring available. Stable switching and swopping as you move around the house. Only major con is app is fairly basic and could provide more options.
customer_reviews.author: Jaam

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this set for a couple of months now and when it works it works but sadly it doesn't all the time. The first issue was our devices getting kicked off the wifi network. Then came the Deco faults, our Bedroom one would go offline at least a couple of times a week and now it's daily. Then the other one started doing the same. It,s a nightmare to get help from TP Link so much so they have shut their phone lines down as they can't cope. Avoid this mesh wifi as there are clearly issues and as you will see with other reviews the same faults.
customer_reviews.author: PhilML

customer_reviews.title: TPLINK M9 plus mesh wifi
customer_reviews.text: The Tplink m9 plus is so easy to set up. My broadband is sky with Q modem/router, I downloaded the app and followed the on screen instructions and everything connected first time. I set the main unit up and connected a couple of devices, when that worked I connected the other two satellites. I did go into the sky router and turned the wifi off to stop confusion. The range throughout my house and garden is fantastic now with no disconnections. The app shows all the devices connected and as I use the guest network it's handy to ask Alexa to turn it on or off. Well recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Grahame

customer_reviews.title: Such a simple set up, transformed our wifi
customer_reviews.text: Utilizing the 3 point Deco M5 system to solve coverage issues in my house. I have Siro 1Gb internet utilizing a Vodafone gigabit combined modem/router. By accessing the router online and switching off the vodafone Wifi signal, I was able to plug-and-play the Deco routers using the app steps in about 10mins. The coverage and speeds throughout the house have all improved greatly. Stability is excellent. One of the Deco routers went down without me realizing, but the mesh network compensated and I had no drop in performance. I'm not I.T. techy at all and I found it all very easy.
customer_reviews.author: otooled6

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace (rubbish) virgin hub 3 WiFi. I now have solid WiFi throughout the house.... Even 100mb/s at the bottom of the garden. Limited network configuration options so may frustrate people who want more granular control but suits me just fine. Slightly tricky to get my Hp Deskjet 3050 printer connected (no WPS option with this deco) but managed in the end. So far so good. Update:. Latest firmware update added WPS which is really helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good signal
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as my many WiFi connected devices were continually dropping in and out of signal with my provider. The devises were extremely easy to set up and the instructions guided you through the process. Since using the TP link Deco P9 I have only had one device that still lost signal, even though it was positioned right next to the devise. After rebooting the devise a number of times over the first few days it (fingers crossed) seems to have settled down. The signal is great I can even get WiFi connection in the garden now, which I have never been able to do.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and very effective
customer_reviews.text: Three smallish disks like hockey pucks that have transformed my WiFi into a stable, usable system. Each unit needs a plug socket and they’re more-or-less plug and go once you’ve downloaded the app. Really simple to install and they’ve transformed my WFH experience in Covid lockdown - personal devices, work phones, work laptops, smart TV, firestick device and other items can all now hook into my WiFi hub. I’m only actually currently using 2 of the 3 and it’s already brilliant; and I have an inkling that if I positioned the 3rd one carefully I could probably have garden WiFi... I wish I’d bought these months ago.
customer_reviews.author: PC Bitseach

customer_reviews.title: Best investment I made!!
customer_reviews.text: I saw the writing on the wall just before lockdown and decided to invest in this Mesh system. I had loads of wifi deadspots and no matter where I located my router I could never get full wifi coverage in my house. Combine that with loads of devices and users - even more with the thought of the kids being home-schooled - I decided to by Deco E4 system. Best investment I made!! Super easy to setup with their app. I positioned the three devices in the optimum position, and hey presto full house coverage! We've had multiple devices streaming netflix, a couple of zoom calls and watching sport and no complaints from anyone. Brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, easy to use and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: The app makes them simple to set up, and the mesh network is self-configuring. If I had to dock points, it would be that it's almost too simple - I still have no idea if it's using the power ring for networking or not! But it works. The whole house now has coverage. I'd tried two wifi boosters previously, and both were unstable and had shorter range. So this gets full marks for functionality. Aesthetically, they look good enough and are relatively discreet on a bookshelf. I really like the option to turn the lights off between certain hours, as that makes them very tolerable. And it's cheaper than most other three-access-point systems, too.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Storry

customer_reviews.title: v2 Hardware has less features than v1
customer_reviews.text: You will receive the V2 hardware which has less features than the previous model. The v1 allowed you to see what devices are connected to each Deco, and how the decos are connected with signal strength, a key feature required to best position the deco's you might think, but the V2 does now have it. Nor does it have the local Web UI that the V1 and M5 has. Very disappoint and misleading in the TPLINK website that these features are available. Will have to return and go back tgo the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: damooooooooooh

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I’ve ever done for home WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Live in a ground floor and basement flat where the router was in the basement. Have virgin internet, was intermittent, constantly dropping out, didn’t reach upstairs. Tried the plug in powerlines still constantly resetting router. Got these. Logged into virgin hub and switched it so it’s router only. Then hooked up these badgers. Had to link them close to the 1st one so they connected but then moved them upstairs. Internet hasn’t dropped out ever since. It’s one wireless network throughout the house, the app is brilliant allowing me to setup an easy network for guests. BEST purchase of the year!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: A lovely elegant design slightly let down by lack of range
customer_reviews.text: A lovely, elegant design. Definitely improves the WIFI coverage around the house. Only downside is the range is not as good as I had hoped so you'll need more of them to provide full coverage (range between units in a brick built house seems to be about 8 - 12 metres, dependent upon how many walls to go through!)
customer_reviews.author: Mr C.

customer_reviews.title: Deco M5, I had heard good things but didn't deliver
customer_reviews.text: These were a huge shame as I was really looking forward to having stronger coverage across the house. The issue was that for gaming the PC we have trouble with was worse. Lag and the FPS was all over the place on these Deco's so we went back to the TP-Links we already own and have had for around 10 years. The occasional re-boot I can live with. Not being able to Game I could not. Most people probably wouldn't notice if used for streaming movies, music and videos etc or browsing the internet and no doubt they would extend coverage. Just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: sofcookies

customer_reviews.title: Best piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: I've been working from home now for a couple of months and the Virgin Media Hub 3.0 is not good enough, countless of calls to the support team in Virgin to try to squeeze the last bit of juice out of it, latencies were really big, connections very unstable while videoconferencing, a nightmare. I installed the 3 M5 and latencies in my devices went from more than 100ms to less than 10ms. The setup is unbelievably simple. 100% recommended, it's worth the investment if you need stable internet around the house. On top of it, it has all the security and automation included. I am a mesh believer now XD
customer_reviews.author: rpablop

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: All round great product. Easy to set up, excellent range and easy to use with very good parental controls. The iPhone app is brilliant and gives a real insight to how the devices in the house hold are using data. QoS is a breeze with this devices as the app already has some profiles configured that you can assign devices to within a few seconds. The Antivirus is brilliant and blocks a lot of junk that I would have been clueless to without. The money reports sent via email always make for an interesting read. Would highly recommend to anyone looking to extend their WiFi network.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Brown

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth it - no more wifi stress
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 3 pack Pros: 1. I've gone from 10mbps to over 30mbps 2. Placed the mesh units in the entrance hallway, kitchen and upstairs bedroom. Wifi throughout the whole house is fantastic. I have a 4 bed detached house that has recently been extended 3. Before installing this I had no Internet in the garden. After installing I now have full Internet coverage in a garden that goes back about 12 metres 4. App is user friendly with a speed checker and security software built in. It allows you to prioritise wifi to certain items (eg a specific laptop or phone) 5. Installation was very easy Cons: 1. None at the moment Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sach. G

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up with the app and visually quite good looking but all devices needed to be manually changed to the new network . The devices do not automatically connect to the new network through our property and can drop back to the original settings which is annoying . It has strengthened the signal in an area of our home that did not always have a strong signal and also boosted the signal in our garden . I think that at there are possible better units out there but at a more expensive price .
customer_reviews.author: roders

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, very good range through several walls.
customer_reviews.text: Bought ths set of 3 M5s having become irritated with a Netgear WIFI extender constantly losing connection, leaving dead spots and fighting with my Virgin Homehub. I installed this last night - the whole thing was a doddle - and on the advice of others while researching this, turned my Virgin HomeHub into modem only mode. Now it's fantastic - I have more than enough wifi everywhere and a lot more control than I used to have. I'm usually hesitant to write a positive review like this till a few months after owning something but then discovered my Dad has the same system (in a much larger house) and it hasn't given a moment's trouble in 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T HAVE USB-C POWER!!
customer_reviews.text: Deco, in their infinite cheapness have 'upgraded' to V2. The specification is identical, but now the power is no longer usb-c but some proprietary short cable. Accordingly you can no longer roof-mount the deco on an extended usb-c lead (with hidden cabling). This is not as sold. Beware if this is vital for your setup (as it was for mine).
customer_reviews.author: Mr. JN

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: Am impressed with these mesh routers and dose cover all locations in my 3 bed semi and well into garden. Easy to use and set up but do miss having a administration web page which I could access from PC, you have to use the app on your mobile. There are better products on the market but these are compact, low profile, easy to use and easy to set up and great value.
customer_reviews.author: SLAPER-1

customer_reviews.title: Works brilliantly
customer_reviews.text: I'd initially bought a Nova mesh system which simply didn't work. Extremely disappointing. I saw this and the strong reviews and I'm delighted with it overall. The app is particularly good in terms of guiding through set up, I have these well spaced across the house and the signal is excellent across the board and doesn't need to be switched on continually or need re-connecting at all. The furthest extender is able to manage a high amount of usage without suffering in terms of performance. I'd recommend this highly.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Buy the M4 version not this E4 version for the same money
customer_reviews.text: I bought the E4 and it only supports 10/100 mbps ports. The M4 version has Gigabit ports. Why does this matter? Well if you run say Virgin like I do, then you switch your Virgin Hub 3 into modem mode then connect the Deco E4 to it via ethernet cable. The result is your 350mbps download speed is restricted to the c.80mbps by the Deco's 10/100 mbps port. Otherwise a really good system. Mesh worked well out into the foil insulated detached garage (now office) away from the house. Recommneded.
customer_reviews.author: bishbosh

customer_reviews.title: Internet all around
customer_reviews.text: While lock down has forced businesses to reconsider their employees location of work, mine has always been at home building my own business. As such, gradually investing in the right equipment is key. When we moved into our town house, it was clear straight away we were going to need a mesh system. Office on top floor, TV on ground was struggling. This system is attached to a TP-Link mobile router and was easy to setup. While the setup of the Deco system is easy, be sure to remember that switching of the WiFi signal on your main router will be important so you don't bounce between devices and loose mesh connectivity. Otherwise, very happy with product!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great wifi throughout the house
customer_reviews.text: These replaced older TPlink wall plugs which did work but I had frequent dropouts. They were easy to set up using the app. I placed one next to the router (which is set to modem) and this became the master unit. I placed one next to the TV downstairs and one at the back of the house where my son plays his xbox. Even the signal in the garden small office is a load better now. Each unit only has a few LAN outputs and my entertainment stuff needed 3. So I bought a TP Link LAN switch, sent the input into it and then took three outputs into all the devices. Works a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: Useless, drops connection 2-3 times a day, no support
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had taken notice of the people saying it keeps dropping the connection. I am having the same issue, 2 or 3 times a day the internet connection is just lost. Decos all have green lights and my wired connection to the BT Router is working perfectly, so the internet connection is good, it is the Decos that are losing the connection. I wish I could send them back. Buyer beware...
customer_reviews.author: FineFirstBooks

customer_reviews.title: Great system
customer_reviews.text: We've got a large, U-shaped bungalow with solid internal walls. Previously, using Powerline and WiFi access points, we were unable to get reliable signal and speed. I bought the Deco P9s and a 3-pack of Deco E4s. Setting up all 6 units was simple but I had to setup the P9s using the WiFi connection first and then position the units to use the Powerline capability. I then used the E4s to ensure maximum signal strength everywhere in the building and adjacent exterior boiler and utility rooms. Everything is working perfectly. I can walk around watching a video with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewinWorth

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Finally sorted the dodgy WiFi in my home. No more drop-outs or dead spots. My home is single story but due to construction it wipes out any WiFi signals. This gives a full mesh WiFi with the added benefit of power line backup with the bonus of being a reasonable price. Easy to set up, follow the in app instructions carefully and you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: ChappersUK

customer_reviews.title: Great for extending WiFi coverage and improving stability
customer_reviews.text: We have a large 4 bed house and had WiFi black spots in several locations, which made working from home difficult. We are with virgin media fibre broadband and it was actually our installer who recommended we purchase these. No more signal dropping in and out and no more black spots. Really effective and would highly recommend - easy to install too!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Delite

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t support power over ethernet
customer_reviews.text: These might look like great value but they aren’t, for the simple reason that they are styled and designed to be ceiling mounted but you can’t use them without the bulky power supply that comes with them, as they don’t support power over Ethernet. This means that in any kind of domestic setting they are difficult to install as you need a socket on the wall or ceiling near where they are, and the resulting installation will be Iglu. I sent it back and spent more money on a Ubiquiti solution instead.
customer_reviews.author: dotmit

customer_reviews.title: Wi Fi magic
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic piece of kit, very quick and simple to set up. My daughter kept complaining she couldn't get wi fi in her bedroom and also our security camera outside the front of our house hardly ever worked and when it did it just kept losing the wi fi signal. But now I have installed the deco m5 my daughter now has full wi fi strength and my security camera is working perfectly with no issues at all. Like other people have mentioned - I too wished I had this fantastic system sooner, it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not suitable for online gaming
customer_reviews.text: The positive first. Very easy to setup via the app. 10 minutes and main and two slaves connected. Unfortunately that was the end of the positives. The two slaves went offline, came back online in irregular intervals, sometimes both, sometimes just one. But what really was catastrophic was the lag. Horrendous pings and absolutely not usable for any form of online gaming or streaming/casting. We live in a typical end of terrace without any fancy walls or massive distances. After two hours of trying to improve the situation it went straight back into the box and will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Doswald

customer_reviews.title: Good home mesh system
customer_reviews.text: Bought this system as had poor wi-fi signal in parts of my house. I've had the TP Link system now for 3 weeks and the wi-fi signal is now considerable stronger and stable throughout the house. I'm able to watch movies on Netflix in my kitchen without interruption whereas previously shows could take forever to load. The set up was very easy and I had no problems in getting the units up and running. I bought 3 units for my 3 bedroom house but have only needed to use 2 units, the coverage being great with just the 2 units. Price was good also. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: sunjos44

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing quality and a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item thinking that TP product would be of a higher standards than others I tried. Sadly I was mistaken, it started to have issues within the 5th week we had it, by disconnecting from the network for no reasons or causing network issues on the home's network where devices were unable to connect to the Internet. Help to fix it hasn't been forthcoming and I am now stuck with some equipment which is useless and can't return now. What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: Freddie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and flexible to use
customer_reviews.text: Used in a large bungalow with conservatory. Main unit in hall, other in lounge and conservatory, give good coverage for numerous devices. Also good coverage onto the patio. Easy to set up and control connected devices. I like the facility which emails me when a new device connects to the network so I can decline it if it is nkt recognised.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tomkins

customer_reviews.title: Good mesh hubs - just a couple more functions to make these 5*
customer_reviews.text: Great hubs, very similar to the Velop 103's I sent back, but the well-designed and highly funcitonal TP-Link app showing connected devices (and ability to easily switch off the supurfulous 5MHz network) makes this far superior to the Linkys competitor. To finish these products off, they should have a) the option to reboot all three hubs in one go, and far more importantly: b) the option to completely switch off WiFi on a schedule (for those of us who cable all hubs through to a main router and therfore the internet/TP Link full-time).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better solution than conventional WiFi extenders
customer_reviews.text: Relatively expensive to buy but worth the investment as mesh technology is much better than e.g. using the mains cables/sockets to boost WiFi to parts of the house that would otherwise have a weak/no signal . Takes a bit of time to find the optimum positioning for each unit - we have at least one unit on every floor of a terrace house - but the app has some good features to help set up. Built-in antivirus, management and parental controls are a bonus - and the optional guest network makes it easy for visitors to connect without compromising network security.
customer_reviews.author: James T

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this system because I was fed up with sky WiFi being unreliable I know that this was a pricey option but I have to say WHAT A DIFFERENCE, I now have excellent WiFi everywhere, I didn't need the 3 but I used them all anyway, so now I can go anywhere in the house and my garden (I have a small garden) without any WiFi drop off. These are easy to install and come with a number of features for both security and family use. In my opinion they are a bit pricey but worth the investment, as my home is 80% WiFi automatically controlled, so a strong signal is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing coverage
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and setup if a little time consuming to transfer all devices over to the new network. Has given me even more coverage than I was expecting. I now have WiFi throughout the house, garden and garage 40 metres away. The additional cyber security gives peace of mind. I have not used the parental control features yet but they look fairly simple and comprehensive. The zig bee coverage has been improved as well making my Hive heating control system even more reliable. It also maintains the Virgin media 100mbps plus speed throughout I highly recommend this device to anyone who wants to massively improve their WiFi coverage and performance throughout the home.
customer_reviews.author: Alistair

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, unlike some rivals.
customer_reviews.text: Finally we found a mesh network that actually deals with our solid walls. We have a well-built house which managed to block all the WiFi signals from pretty much anything we had, Virgin boosters, other mesh networks (returned when they didn't do the job). This one works, so buy it. Haven't called tech support so I can't rate them anything other than 4 stars without it looking bad.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal!  A whole level up from previous generations of wi-fi range extenders.
customer_reviews.text: It took me 3 attempts to set this up: I don't know why but it simply wouldn't work... then it did on the 3rd attempt. I carefully followed the excellent technical advice given by other reviewers here, and it finally clicked. And then... WOW! There is a laptop in a distant room where the download speed went up by a factor 20 (!) and upload by a factor of 10. That is, it went from about 12Mbps to 120Mbps. Jeez! And the range and constant reliability of the cover in house and garden is fabulous. Best bit of kit I've bought in many a year. If you need proper and reliable wifi cover, get this!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy the brief

customer_reviews.title: Great when working!
customer_reviews.text: Great when they worked, various connections would be lost for no apparent reason and quite randomly after previously having no issues (frustrating for kids mid game), I'm sure with long winded conversations with tech support we may have fixed the issue but these are "plug and play" and that's what I expected. There were no DNS resolution errors, No IP address conflicts etc, just strange behaviour in that even with a full WiFi signal previously connected (for days) devices would just lose Internet and would require a system reboot to fix. Maybe I had a duff unit out of the 3. Brilliant idea, great when working so maybe try them out as I could of just been unlucky.
customer_reviews.author: Ksw1monk

customer_reviews.title: Does all it needs to do
customer_reviews.text: For some reason my WiFi didn’t provide a signal upstairs so I decided to give these a try. Connecting them up was relatively straightforward and I now have full strength signal all over the house and one street away! The LED signal in the top is a bit distracting at night but somehow, and I have no idea how, Alexa and I managed to create a routine which deactivates the LEDs from 10pm to 7am. Yes, they’re compatible with Alexa. In summary these were easy to link up, they’ve boosted the signal all through the house and seem to get on well with Alexa. What’s not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Mr B.

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid WiFi in every corner of our house
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep this short and simple. 1. It works brilliantly. 2. 2 units cover our victorian terrace house. 3. Wifi deadspots and wifi signal / throughput are pretty perfect in every room. 4. In my previous deadspot speedtest results went from 1mb to 80+ 5. App works well and child controls and security are easy to use. 6. Resolved bandwidth throughput using virgin super hub. Previously having 4 people (2 adults and 2 kids) work from home and streaming games and video would impact performance. Not a problem anymore and that using a 100mb virgin connection. Well worth the money and would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MR M D PENDLEBURY

customer_reviews.title: It works! It really works!!!
customer_reviews.text: As myself and my husband are working from home and our son on the PS4 in the lockdown the pressure on the Wifi has been pretty intense. My husband was doing some research and came across this. We are renting a 3 story house and so it quite hard to get a decent signal to the top and far ends of the house. This system is INCREDIBLE! It took me about 15 minutes to set up and it works a treat! There is not one corner of our home that isn't covered. I love that I have control over the network too (cue maniacal laughter!). If teenager monster plays up badly having control over the Wifi is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but in need of a firmware update to indicate when backhaul is in use.
customer_reviews.text: I thought my units had developed a problem, but it turns out I had plugged the primary unit into an extension lead: big no-no! One problem is that unlike the p7, there is no light to indicate whether you are using ethernet backhaul successfully or whether the node has switched over to wifi. TP Link say they are working on a firmware update. The Powerline ethernet backhaul works great. I can pull over 130MB down, which is very quick for powerline speeds.
customer_reviews.author: elstevador

customer_reviews.title: All my WiFi problems solved!
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying 2 sets to cover my old Victorian house which for some reason only give WiFi by line of sight. Previously I used a plethora of WiFi extenders and power line lan extenders which worked sporadically. 3 should be enough for most homes, but I was left with a couple of dead spots... The set up was easy and quick. Make sure you follow the instructions to the word, because there are a couple of steps that you can mess up if you’re not careful. I can’t recommend this product enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jarvichi

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Well being a complete novice at this and my virgin 3 hub performance being woeful I decided to give these a go. It was up and running in 20 mins most difficult bit was getting the virgin router into modem mode so nothing to do with this. Then followed the app and have WiFi everywhere even the garden can't recommend enough
customer_reviews.author: Smiffy

customer_reviews.title: How did I ever manage without it!
customer_reviews.text: Have been debating whether to purchase the M5 for quite a while as my Plusnet router's WiFi was really poor. I had to keep turning WiFi on and off on my devices as it keep freezing. Was even thinking of going to another provider. Glad I went with the M5 whole home pack, had all three units set up within 15 mins. The app was excellent at walking you through the whole process. WiFi is now excellent (65mbps) throughout my home even out into the garden. No more WiFi freezing or trying to get my devices working on the fringes of WiFi coverage from my aging router, 5 bars everywhere now, I'm impressed, should have bought these ages ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wifi through the house at last
customer_reviews.text: This has really enabled Wifi throughout the house. Previously we had used TP Link plug extenders which was a bit cumbersome with wires and additional routers, but these are far superior. Plug them in and you have complete Wifi. Devices connect to the strongest signal seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Mr D Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and works great
customer_reviews.text: As I've said in the title, these boxes are very easy to set up and they work very well. You need to download the mobile app and it then guides you through the installation. I set up the three stations on three floors in under 15 minutes. No deep technical knowledge required. They have been running for around a month now with no need for any further intervention. I now have a better wifi signal across the whole house, prioritised video streaming and I can change broadband supplier (and router) without having to change all of my device settings.
customer_reviews.author: Jim A

customer_reviews.title: Drops connection
customer_reviews.text: Setting this up is a doddle. The recommendation for my house is 2 pods, but I opted for 3. A TV in the kitchen snug used to drop connection to my BT hub maybe 1-2 times over a 4-5 hour evening. Not a lot but still frustrating. Now I’ve connected it to Deco and it’s drops out every 10-15 minutes albeit only for a few seconds. I’ve now reconnected directly to BT and it’s stable again. So what is the point of the deco system? It’s worse than before!
customer_reviews.author: Jay G

customer_reviews.title: Good units. Quite Large
customer_reviews.text: The performance of these is really good and they are very easy to set up. Value for money is really good. I realise these were an older model but for the cost they solved the issue at my daughters house. Using the app is straightforward and speed and coverage is excellent. They have 2 ethernet ports on each unit to hardwire devices. The reason they lose a star is because they are fairly large units so not that discreet. If this is not an issue then I would say buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Mr M H Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I had all sorts of issue with my wifi, and had tried power plugs and a mesh system from another provider and i had crappy, unstable wifi. Anyway, the good news is that this worked like a dream. easy to set up and once i got the positioning right (moved one of the devices about ten foot) it solved all my wifi issues.
customer_reviews.author: akerlad

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding WiFi speed and coverage
customer_reviews.text: Just brilliant. I achieved excellent WiFi throughout the whole house with this system and coupled it with a 4G Huawei router. Simple plug and play setup made everything very easy too. Very impressed with the speed and coverage - would highly recommend this to others. One thing to note, I installed this in a very large farmhouse with thick stone walls and I needed 6 x Decos to get perfect coverage throughout. Expensive, but reassuring quality - you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Gareth Evans

customer_reviews.title: Returning this
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately since the installation it's been a nightmare. The installation is easy but the wifi keeps dropping. Also in the top floor the speed test with Deco is actually lower than without which doesn't make sense. Not only that customer support is international only and you need to spend a lot just to call. No local support. I'm going to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo

customer_reviews.title: Slow wifi, bad coverage, cheaply built
customer_reviews.text: I assumed this product has a built in powerline so that it can connect to the router via the electrical wires when its placed in a wireless dead zone, that was clearly not the case... also the wireless speed is about 50mb while next to the hub even though the ethernet speed is 350mb via the hub itself. Overall the product feels very cheap and not well made, for the price i could get multiple AP units hardwired to the router directly.
customer_reviews.author: Omey

customer_reviews.title: A great way to take back control
customer_reviews.text: The signal is fantastic, the app is a little glitchy and make sure you add devices to profiles as they go on otherwise it is very difficult to determine what should go where. Drove my kids insane which was the whole point being able to control the times they were online by setting times and bed times and removing the ability to log on to certain apps I.e TIL too. The only real issue is if they don’t touch the phone/tablet when the time begins the time gets very quickly eaten by WhatsApp/house party etc.
customer_reviews.author: damianh

customer_reviews.title: Not stable - suggest looking elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: A single unit seems to work fine but build a mesh of 2 or 3 and the whole system starts randomly dropping connections. Doesn’t do it for all devices ( my issue is with tablets and phones) but it is really not what you need in a WiFi mesh system. Looking through the various web forum I find lots of people reporting the same problem, over months, with no fix. Though I hate to say it, as I love the TP-Link brand, I would recommend looking for another manufacturer. I recently installed the BT mesh system in my mother in laws house and that runs like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Maple005

customer_reviews.title: Good for video/movie streaming and internet surfing but not for online gaming
customer_reviews.text: The quality of your home electrical wiring is the unknown factor for this system. I got this and my optic fibre had a speed of 95mbps and had repeated disconnection when I surf the net and played mmo's (evidence of data packet loss?). It worsens when I have the washing machine on. When I switched to direct router connection, I got 220mbps and less disconnections when surfing and playing mmo's. The wifi and powerline are good for streaming movies, videos, and overall wifi but not for mmo and surfing at the same time in the same pc.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought as part of a solution to exit from BT (with an old extender) to Plusnet and improve WiFi. Initially used in extender mode still with BT, then obtained old BT business Hub 6 (as a modem) and used it in full router mode. Subsequently shifted to Plusnet and all I had to change was my login details. Neat. Great experience throughout from opening the box, to 'plumbing in', to reconfiguring to router mode. The initial set up was easy and opening up the box felt high quality, a bit like an Apple purchase. The WiFi coverage has been great throughout my house and I'm really pleased; not least as I've shifted from expensive BT and not succumbed to Halo.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie S

customer_reviews.title: The best one yet
customer_reviews.text: At last a WiFi repeater and extender that’s actually works. I did buy 4 E4 units though. Very easy to set up. I did find switching off the WIFI part of my plusnet wireless router essential to avoid signal conflict. That meant having to go into the admin part of the router which is easy enough to do if you have some knowledge about how to do these things. I now get superfast broadband at 65mb download and about 20mb upload right across our 3500 sq ft house.
customer_reviews.author: Nickb

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mesh signal extender to sort out dodgy wi-fi signals due to the thick walls in our old house. Very easy to set up and link the signals through the 3 units. No technical knowledge needed, just the ability to read the short instructions, then download a simple to use app. I'm using with recently installed full fibre internet connection which had a weak router signal, so wasn't delivering the high speed benefits I anticipated. With these I've increased the speed we are receiving and eradicated the signal drop outs that were occurring before.
customer_reviews.author: IDMS

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: So far very good. I have move these units from my main residence to a holiday home frequently without difficulty. Coded one of the units plugged into the Router as the Master Unit so as not to reset the system each time they are moved. Not sure if this is absolutely necessary but the sequencing works for me. Both houses have 4 plus bedrooms and previously, even with fibre broad band, had dead spots. No issues now. Much better than 1st generation range extenders. On strength of 1st purchase plan on buying a second pair
customer_reviews.author: patrick keogh

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought the TP-Link Deco M5 years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! We live in a typical 3 bedroom terraced house. Our Virgin Media wi-fi hub is in the front living room. Our wi-fi was very poor in the back kitchen and the rear bedrooms. Now we have over 100+mbps from front to back. Absolutely brilliant! I've tried all sorts of range extenders over the years with limited success. The TP-Link Deco M5 is the perfect solution. Very simple set up. We can now also get wi-fi in the back garden and patio! Should have bought this item years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mr S A McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Previously lived in a 4 bed, 3 storey new build town house where the wifi from my ISP router just "floated" up the stairs and in to every room. Now we live in a Victorian Terraced house with brick everywhere. BT Master socket at the front of the house, working from home office at the back. WiFi practically gone. Got the M5 3 pack, one in each room on the middle floor, now we have strong WiFi in every room.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended - stable and strong signal
customer_reviews.text: After many years of struggling with a wi-fi signal in the whole house and trying several products only to disappoint, I found these ones. They really do what is says on the tin. Easy to install, stable and strong signal. The app is good as well. I can highly recommend these if you want a strong stable wifi signal in your whole house. You pay a bit more, but your frustrations are gone. Happy surfing.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant.  Just brilliant.
customer_reviews.text: Our house is old with thick brick walls and I have tried everything to have a good wifi signal throughout, but nothing seem to work. All of your fancy pants boosters made very little difference if any. Most of them would crash the router. Then I came across the Deco system and thought I would give it a try. I couldn't believe it, my whole house now has full strength WIFI. What a great idea and product. The phone app you can install for this system works like a dream, and gives you full control. Fully recommended.
customer_reviews.author: James J

customer_reviews.title: Wow proper impressed
customer_reviews.text: I had the Orbi set up but no idea how or why but it stopped working. Anyway bought this one and not only cheaper than Orbi but mikes better, always got max reception everywhere in the house. I used to struggle with my 5 x Sonos speakers but not the case with TP Link set up. Cannot recommend this set up enough to be honest, only been up and working 4 days buts its so good.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel Turver

product_meta.title: TP-LINK DECO M5 3 PACK Deco M5 Whole-Home Wi-Fi(R) System, Mesh Network
product_meta.description: TP-LINK DECO M5 3 PACK Deco M5 Whole-Home Wi-Fi(R) System, Mesh Network

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars810 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
